remarks:
The induction postulate: any class containing zero and closed under the successor operation contains all natural numbers.  One of Peano's five postulates for arithmetic.  Proposition 7.30(5) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 43, except our proof does not require the Axiom of Infinity.  The more traditional statement of mathematical induction as a theorem schema, with a basis and an induction step, is derived from this theorem as theorem ~ findes .  (Contributed by NM, 18-Feb-2004.)
